metadata.title: USN-6488-1 -- strongSwan vulnerability
metadata.description: Florian Picca discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled certain DH public values. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause strongSwan to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6488-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  strongswan-nm - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-scepclient - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-charon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 libstrongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 charon-systemd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 charon-cmd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-pki - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-starter - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.2 No subscription required
